title: Samantha Ross
text: Hi there! My name is Samantha and I am a fourth-year undergraduate student at UCSB, majoring in Environmental Studies. When I am not in class or rolling bagels at my job, I like to read, make art and good food, play music with my sister, and explore Santa Barbara with my friends.

title: Books
text:

title: Oryx and Crake
text: My friend Ailish gave me this book in high school. I didn’t read it til now. It is one of her favorites.

title: The Serviceberry
text: I read this book for Professor Lisa Sideris’ Nature Spirituality course this spring quarter. Then I picked some ripe and tangy loquats off a tree on campus and thought a lot about gift economies. A short, profound read.

title: Half Asleep In Frog Pajamas
text: I first read Still Life With Woodpecker and got hooked on Tom Robbins and his whimsical, philosophic writing. I found this gem at Paperback Alley in Old Town Goleta.

title: Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood
text: My grandma, Martha Ross, passed away a couple years ago. My grandpa wanted me to look through her things and take what I wanted. I chose this book because it looked worn and loved. It makes me feel closer to her, seeing the pages she dog-eared.

title: Finding the Mother Tree
text: Professor Iris Holzer recommended we (the students of her soil science class) see Suzanne Simard speak at Cambell Hall. She is a forestry scientist, who has done groundbreaking research on forest ecology and plant intelligence. I found her talk to be so inspiring that I bought her book. The Mother Tree Project is something I’d like to get involved in.

title: Women Who Run With the Wolves
text: Myths and Stories of the Wild Woman Archetype… this book reminds me to listen to my instincts. And helped me make some hard decisions. My cousin Bella recommended it to me, and a few weeks later I found it at Walden Pond Books in Oakland- thank you Bella!

title: Like Water for Chocolate
text: This is my third time reading this book. I read it first in Spanish - Como Agua Para Chocolate - in my high school AP Spanish class. I’ve read this copy once before, but I love it so much I read it again. There’s not many books I choose to re-read. My mom was gifted this copy for her 24th birthday by her best friend Jasmin, then she gave it to me. See the sweet note below…

title: Song of Solomon
text: Like Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood, this book is from my grandma. Song of Solomon is my favorite book I have read this year - I laughed, I cried, I felt nostalgic for a place and time I’ve never existed in. I recommend this powerful novel to anyone. “You wanna fly, you got to give up the shit that weighs you down.”

title: The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy
text: My friends, Sofia and Steven, and I read this book for our book club. Then, we watched the movie. The book was better.

title: Still Life With Woodpecker
text: Winter break, my two friends, Sema and Naomi, and I went on a glorious PNW road trip. Sitting in a Portland cafe, a super cool looking girl was reading Jitterbug Perfume by Tom Robbins. I took a mental note, and a couple weeks later I found this one at Bart’s Books in Ojai. I like this quote, “Don’t let yourself be victimized by the age you live in. It’s not the times that will bring us down, any more than it’s society. When you put the blame on society, then you end up turning to society for the solution.” And the passage about smoking.

title: The Home Place
text: I read this book for Professor Lisa Sideris’ Nature Spirituality course this spring quarter. A beautiful love story about Lanham and the natural world, exploring themes of race and the American landscape.

title: About Me
text:
